poem.content:
The earth exhales, a silver, shadowed yard,
where risk takes root, a feral, hungry thing,
an animal instinct, biting, sharp and hard.

We begin here, with nothing left to lend,
except a sketch of galaxies weâ€™ve known,
a private orbit, spinning without end.

My duty calls, a whisper in the breeze,
to label hopes with names that cannot stay,
and load the heart with silent ecstasies.

I watch the cosmos punch through night's dark veil,
until a yearning rises, deep and vast,
a lonely comet on a frozen trail.

No grand escape, no starburst bright and bold,
just whispered promises, fragile and unseen,
a story quietly, carefully told.

And though the silver fades to dusty gray,
though earth remembers moments left unspun,
I still recall the promise of that day.
